    • Constructor Detail

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper()
        Default constructor for Minesweeper class. Initiates the board to beginner difficulty.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(int width,
                   int height,
                   int noOfMines)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class.
        Parameters:
        width - boards width. That is the number of cells in a row.
        height - boards height. That is the number of cells in a column.
        noOfMines - number of mines present on the board. Must be less than the area of the board.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(java.lang.String mf)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class that only takes a MineField json string in.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(int width,
                   int height,
                   double mineDistribution)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class that uses a percentage difficulty of mines. Number is casted down to integer amount
        Parameters:
        width - boards width. That is the number of cells in a row.
        height - boards height. That is the number of cells in a column.
        mineDistribution - percent number of mines present on the board. Should be in the form 0.0 <= mineDistribution <= 1.0.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(int width,
                   int height,
                   int noOfMines,
                   java.lang.String jsonMineFieldStr)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class that uses a pre-specified mine field.
        Parameters:
        width - boards width. That is the number of cells in a row.
        height - boards height. That is the number of cells in a column.
        noOfMines - number of mines present on the board. Must be less than the area of the board.
        jsonMineFieldStr - string representation of the json representation of a minefield.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(Difficulty difficulty)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class that uses difficulty settings (enums). Uses the classic Minesweeper game difficulty parameters.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - enum difficulty of the board.

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(Difficulty difficulty,
                   MineField mf)
        Constructor for Minesweeper class that uses a difficulty setting (enum) and a pre-specified MineField. Uses the classic Minesweeper game difficulty parameters.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - enum difficulty of the board.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        private void setup(int width,
                   int height,
                   int noOfMines)
        Sets private variables (e.g. widht/height, noOfMines, board, etc.). Also resets the game values (e.g. game time, is game won, etc.).
        Parameters:
        width - boards width. That is the number of cells in a row.
        height - boards height. That is the number of cells in a column.
        noOfMines - number of mines present on the board. Must be less than the area of the board.

      • setup

        private void setup(int width,
                   int height,
                   int noOfMines,
                   MineField mf)
        Same as setup method but sets the minefield to the specficed one afterwards.
        Parameters:
        width - boards width. That is the number of cells in a row.
        height - boards height. That is the number of cells in a column.
        noOfMines - number of mines present on the board. Must be less than the area of the board.

      • buildGUI

        public void buildGUI()
        Initialises and displays all the GUI.

        private void loadUI()
        Load buttons to the JFrame and assign their action listeners.

        private void loadFileMenu()
        Load the File menu component options and adds each option's action listener code.

      • copySettings

        private void copySettings(Minesweeper game)
        Copies settings (difficulty, strategy, etc.) of one game over to another.
        Parameters:
        game - game that the settings of are going to be copied.

      • configureSolver

        private void configureSolver(SolverThreadWrapper solver)
        Sets the desired options of the solver depending on what settings the user has selected.
        Parameters:
        solver - the solver object that options will be changed.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Redraws the board, updating all cells appearance and behaviour.

      • probe

        public void probe(int x,
                  int y)
        Called when a cell is wished to be cleared. Will not affect flagged cells. Clears hint cells and probabilities. Increments move count. Checks if game is won or lost.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell.

      • quietProbe

        public void quietProbe(int x,
                       int y)
        Same as probe but does not update any UI elements. Used when performing simulations.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell.

      • changeCellSize

        private void changeCellSize(int size)
        Changes each cells size.
        Parameters:
        size - what size the cells should be changed to. Should be more than 0.

      • clearNeighbours

        public void clearNeighbours(int x,
                            int y)
        Clear the neightbouring cells around a cell. Used when a cell with number 0 is probed. Originally also used when performing a double click action but this encounted various bugs so was abandoned.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell which neighbours should be cleared.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell which neighbours should be cleared.

      • endGame

        private void endGame()
        Called when the game has been won or lost. Changes UI, stops game timer and "unlocks" the minefield so that all cells true behaviour is revealed (mine, number, etc.).

      • resetUIDetails

        public void resetUIDetails()
        Resets all the UI elements to their default text.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Generate a fresh board and a new minefield.

      • openAllCells

        public void openAllCells(java.lang.String password)
                  throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Opens all remaining closed on the board.
        Parameters:
        password - the password that will be used to unlock the minefield.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - when passed password is incorrect.

      • won

        private boolean won()
        Check to see if the game as been won.
        Returns:
        if the remaining number of closed cells is equal to the number of mines in the minefield.

      • getNeighbours

        private java.util.List<Cell> getNeighbours(int x,
                                           int y)
        Returns a list of of the neighbouring cells around the specified cell.
        Parameters:
        x - X-axis coordinate of cell.
        y - Y-axis coordinate of cell.
